what kind of engineer are you?

I'm a software engineer, specializing in full-stack development. My primary technologies include React, TypeScript, Python, Flask, and PostgreSQL. I also have experience with data analysis and visualization using R. My experience in building the StellenBooks project has equipped me with a solid understanding of database design, API development, and cross-functional collaboration.

what kind of engineer are you?

I'm a software engineer, specifically a full-stack engineer. My skills span across the entire stack, from front-end development with React and TypeScript, to back-end development with Python and Flask, and even database management with PostgreSQL.

As a software engineer, I've been able to apply my technical skills to real-world problems, like the ones I faced while working on the StellenBooks project. I was able to identify business problems, propose technical solutions, and implement them to improve the customer support experience.

My experience has taught me the importance of understanding the business needs and requirements, as well as the technical skills required to deliver a high-quality solution. I've worked on various projects, from building a customer self-service portal to implementing predictive insights and performance tracking tools.

I'd say my expertise lies at the intersection of technical and business acumen, which I believe is a key characteristic of a successful software engineer.

what kind of engineer are you?

I'm a Full Stack Engineer, meaning I have experience working on both the front-end (client-side) and back-end (server-side) of a web application. My tech stack includes React, TypeScript, Python, Flask, PostgreSQL, and R, which I've used to build and deploy a customer support ticketing system for StellenBooks.
